intro: Eremostachys nuda f. pinnatipartita, commonly known as the pinnately divided eremostachys, is a succulent plant characterized by its fleshy, gray-green leaves with a distinctive pinnate division. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is native to arid regions of Central Asia. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the summer months. It is well adapted to drought conditions, with thick leaves that store water and reduce transpiration. This cultivar is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in rocky or sandy soils.
